places.generalDescription: Sanctuary of Truth is a 20-story complex made entirely of hand-hewn wood carvings, still under construction but open for tours. Similar to the Tibetan sand mandala art, this massive teak structure is a blend of architecture and philosophy, depicting lessons from various religions emphasizing respect for elders, choosing company wisely, and treating others well. It serves as a remarkable place for reflection on higher ideals and the impermanence of life.

sources.snippet: Erected in 1981, and constructed entirely from teak wood, the Sanctuary of Truth is Pattaya‚Äôs most impressive historical feature. The architecture tells the tale of the regions rich cultural, philosophical and religious history. As well as the temple itself you‚Äôll be treated to countless exquisite examples of handcrafted sculpture, depicting gods and deities from regional folklore  The monument stands at an impressive 105 meters, commanding the skyline.
sources.shortName: 23 UNIQUE Things to Do in Pattaya [in 2024]

sources.snippet: Sanctuary of Truth: A Symbol of Eternal Love: The Sanctuary of Truth stands as a testament to timeless love and spirituality. This awe-inspiring wooden temple, crafted entirely from teak, boasts intricate carvings that depict mythological deities and celestial beings. Couples can explore the majestic corridors hand in hand, marveling at the architectural marvel that symbolizes the enduring nature of love.

sources.snippet: The Sanctuary of Truth is a magnificent all-wood building by the sea in Pattaya that proudly exclaims the genius and spirituality of the Thai. places.name: Sanctuary of Truth

reviews.text:
The temple itself is absolutely stunning - one of the most beautiful I've seen in Asia. The craftsmanship and detail are truly impressive, and it feels very unique compared to other temples in the region.

However, the ticket price is insanely high, especially for Thailand. Also, you're required to join a guided tour to enter, which honestly wasn't great. Our guide seemed to just make things up or tell random stories that weren't very engaging. We ended up walking away from the group - which I highly recommend. Otherwise, you won't be able to take proper photos, since the group moves quickly and keeps you in one area.

Officially, after an hour with the guide, you're allowed to explore on your own and take pictures, but by then, you're already tired and not in the mood. So just quietly disconnect earlier if you want to enjoy it at your own pace.

Overall, the temple is incredible and definitely worth seeing once - just be prepared for the high price and the tour system.

The Sanctuary of Truth in Thailand is truly a wonder and an unforgettable experience. The entire museum is made of wood, and the intricate carvings are stunning. The place is not just beautiful but also deeply meaningful, with its philosophy and the Seven Truths of Life that can truly change how we see the world and make it a better place. The experience there was marvellous and very peaceful. It is also a fantastic spot for photography, with every corner offering something unique. I would highly recommend everyone to visit this place at least once in their life.

This is an overly impressive piece of architecture. First, you get to see wood workers constructing new additions to the building. You get an indepth explanation of everything you pass.

When you get to the building you will want to photograph every minute detail you, which is an impossible task. Every inch of the building is fascinating with a deep story attached to it. You could spend days here discovering everything.

Beyond the building they have food and other attractions. Boat rides, animal rides, massages, and photo ops. You will have a great time exploring and hanging out here. Give yourself many hours for a trip here.

places.generalDescription: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden is a sprawling 500-acre attraction that offers a diverse range of experiences. In addition to its themed gardens showcasing Thai culture, it features elephant shows and rides, as well as a variety of dining options. The garden is one of the largest botanical gardens in Southeast Asia and boasts an array of plant species, including orchids, bonsai trees, and cacti. Visitors can also enjoy performances, activities, and even explore a small zoo within the expansive grounds.

sources.snippet: Nong Nooch Village is a must-visit romantic spot in Pattaya, offering couples a unique blend of beautiful gardens and cultural experiences. The village showcases meticulously landscaped gardens with exotic plants, vibrant flowers, and serene water features that create a romantic and tranquil atmosphere. Couples can take leisurely walks hand-in-hand through the various themed gardens like the French Garden or the European Renaissance Garden while admiring the stunning scenery.

places.name: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden

reviews.text: It was a memorable experienceü§©. The garden is massive so you need to ride a shuttle bus to go around the garden. They will stop is every station for you to enjoy sightseeing and take pictures. Here you can interact with elephants too. Kids will enjoy the last stop coz it is full of dinosaurs üòÇ.

We visited Nong Nooch Botanical Garden and even though we arrived a bit late (around 5 PM, and it closes at 6 PM), we had an absolutely amazing time exploring the gardens.

Since we had about an hour, we decided to take the sightseeing bus, which was a perfect choice - it took us around the garden and allowed us to see so many of the beautiful areas quickly.
The views were stunning: endless colorful gardens, peaceful landscapes, and beautifully maintained areas everywhere we looked.

We also visited the dinosaur section and a beautiful temple area, which added a lot of excitement for the kids.
The dinosaur statues were huge and very realistic - the children had a lot of fun running around and exploring.
The temple was peaceful and beautifully designed, offering a nice cultural touch to the visit.

However, while we truly enjoyed the gardens themselves, we were very disappointed to learn about the elephant shows.
As many others have mentioned, the shows are cruel and unethical, and it's heartbreaking to see animals treated this way for entertainment.
Because of this, we chose not to pay for or watch the show and we would not recommend supporting it.
We believe that such practices do not belong in a place that celebrates the beauty of nature.

In summary:

The gardens are beautiful and worth seeing.

But we strongly encourage the management to stop the elephant shows and shift the focus entirely to the wonderful botanical experience they have built.

Until then, we cannot fully recommend a visit here unless it is solely to enjoy the gardens without supporting the animal shows.

A nice layout with lot of greenery. Divided into several zones. Animals, dinosaurs, pots piled up and structures made of them. Vibrant array of colors. Treat to the eyes. Hanging garden and lot more. Elephant rides also available here. Want to grab a quick snack visit Big C located within the premises. Don't forget to book their bus. Large area to cover.

reviews.text:
Incredible fun waterpark with stunning garden and double wave pool. Amazing view from the top of the rides surrounding by the mountains.

We have so much fun. Must visit!!!  I definitely take the kids here again.

Service needs to be improved from the ticket counter to information. Someone has stolen the kid glasses from the house we rent and no security check, no CCTV. No one ever walks to cleck but only says nobody has returned it yet.

We had so much fun here. Got our tickets online with a discount. Aside from water activities they also have table tennis and badminton. I love that they have a lot of stalls for food. Also there's free videos for the rides, just tell the operator and they will scan your wristband and you can claim your free videos on a machine and send it to your email.

Except the prices, everything's great.
There are many fantistic slides, pools water flows where can make everybody feels exciting.
But the only problem of this place is very expensive price of all kind of things which sells inside, not only the entrance, locker fee but also the foods and drinks.
They inspect every customer's bags completely to check and prohibit of bring in own foods at the gate. Only the drinking water is allowed.

places.generalDescription: Bali Hai Pier, often referred to as Pattaya Pier, is a vibrant hub located at the southern tip of Pattaya Bay, right at the end of Walking Street. This bustling pier serves as a launch point for numerous adventures, including ferries to Coral Island (Koh Larn), speedboat charters, and exciting fishing and scuba diving excursions. The jetty extends impressively into the bay, flanked by an array of boats ready to whisk travelers away on their aquatic escapades.

losseum Show Pattaya is a famous cabaret performance in Thailand, lasting 75 minutes with 16 spectacular acts, blending dance, singing, and multicultural performances. The theater is designed in the style of ancient Rome, with over 1,000 seats. Stunning costumes, modern sound, and lighting create impressive visual effects. The professional cast delivers captivating performances. Tickets range from 800 to 1,200 baht, with three shows daily. It's a great entertainment option when visiting Pattaya.

Visited the Colosseum Show in Pattaya and honestly, it was a surprising and entertaining experience! The entire performance is done by ladyboys, and they truly work hard and perform with passion. Their costumes, expressions, and energy light up the whole stage.

What stood out most was the unexpected dance on Indian songs ‚Äì felt like a piece of home in Thailand! The vibe is fun and family-friendly, with a mix of cultures in the music and choreography.

At the end of the show, you can take photos with the performers for 100 Baht, and they're really sweet and welcoming.

Rating: 4.5/5 üåà ‚Äì A unique experience full of color, talent, and global vibes. Definitely worth a visit!

Marvellous show.all worth tickets and time.
1hr went with awww. Many shows and hardly 10sec break in shows. It's mesmerizing to see how fast they change stage sets,background and music.
Performers were all amazing, choreography is amazing.
Their costume, make up,hair and headgear were all detailed,very creative, visually stunning.
Stage was very high tech, rotating elements, air transport element.lights ,music were all amazing.
Full hour paisa wassool show.very entertainment.
Before show few performers will be standing outside so that you can click photos with them.
For finale all performers will come on stage.

The show is lively and colorful. Costumes are okay overall - some are impressive. Most performers were pretty good, and it's definitely worth a visit if you haven't been before.

The venue is decent, and the seats are comfortable.

üì∏ You're allowed (or they don't bother) to take photos during the first approx 15 minutes of the show. After that, staff will shine laser pointers at anyone trying / or taking photos or videos - can be a bit annoying for other guests.

There was no photo session with performers after the show during my visit - maybe we missed it, or it just wasn't happening that night. So it was a straightforward experience: sit, watch, and go.

üëâ Still, a fun and memorable show that's worth experiencing at least once if you're in Pattaya.

A lovely show with excellent coordination of lights, costumes, and dance performances. The visual appeal is undeniable, and the production is impressive. However, the 1-hour program felt unnecessarily stretched, as many acts were quite similar in style.

Photography is allowed only for the first 5‚Äì10 minutes, after which lasers are directed towards the audience to discourage further pictures. I strongly feel age restrictions are necessary, as some performances included erotic elements that were not suitable for children.

On the plus side, the venue is conveniently located, and food options are easily available nearby. Overall, worth a visit if you're in Pattaya - but best enjoyed by an adult audience.

places.name: Tiffany's Show Pattaya

reviews.text:
Tiffany's Show Pattaya is easily the FINEST masterpiece of cabaret in Thailand, and I say this after watching many.

The ticket price is incredibly reasonable considering the sheer production value poured into this show. The level of talent, beauty, and professionalism from all the performers is stunning-truly incomparable. If you want to experience transvestite cabaret as an art form, this is the one to see.

From Lady Gaga to Beyonc√©, from high-tech staging to acrobatics, the performance is multilayered and dynamic. Unlike other cabarets that lean into slapstick or even degrading humor, Tiffany's is designed to awe and inspire. They even incorporate masculine energy into the mix, making it a refreshing and sophisticated experience.

A special mention to their inclusivity-not only are the performers incredible, but even the ticket booth staff and ushers are trans professionals. The usher, in particular, had eagle eyes for spotting people sneaking recordings, which was much needed since so many ignored the ‚ÄúNO RECORDING‚Äù rule displayed on screens.

None of the performers were pushy about photo sessions either. I brought my sister here for her birthday since she had always wanted to see the show. She took a photo with one of the performers, and she was so elegant, cheerful, and down-to-earth person.

A truly amazing experience that I would recommend to everyone!

An absolutely amazing experience! The show featured incredibly beautiful performers in stunning, elaborate costumes. Every detail - from the lighting to the choreography - was top-notch.

The energy, the music, and the atmosphere were fantastic. If you appreciate live performances and theatrical flair, it's definitely worth the price. The costumes alone were a highlight - truly magnificent and dazzling throughout.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Pattaya!

Tiffany Show Pattaya offers an exceptional entertainment experience with talented performers and exquisite costumes. The production is lively, well-organized, and thoroughly engaging. The venue provides comfortable seating and a welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend this show for an unforgettable evening in Pattaya

Way too hot so wind at all.

I recently visited Sky Gallery, and it truly lives up to its reputation as one of the most beautiful dining spots with a stunning sea view. The atmosphere is vibrant and lively, but I must say it was extremely crowded during my visit. It seems to be a very popular place, so it gets busy quickly. Despite the rush, we were lucky enough to get a table without too much waiting, but I would definitely recommend pre-booking a table in advance if you want a smoother experience.

The food and drinks were very good, served fresh, and the staff managed everything well considering the crowd. What really stood out was the view-it's absolutely breathtaking, especially during sunset, and worth the visit on its own.

Overall, Sky Gallery is a great place to enjoy a meal with friends or family, but keep in mind that it gets very crowded. Plan ahead and reserve a table to make the most of your time there.

places.generalDescription: Art In Paradise Pattaya is a captivating and interactive museum covering 5,800 square meters and featuring over a hundred 3D paintings. Visitors can immerse themselves in the art by posing with the vivid and realistic artworks, which include dioramas, dinosaurs, safari scenes, ocean-themed displays, and portraits of influential figures. The museum offers an engaging experience for both kids and adults, inviting them to take creative photos with the larger-than-life paintings.

places.name: Art In Paradise Pattaya

reviews.text: A must visit place with kids. Many tour plans won't hav this in tour itinerary. As soon as we enter they ask us to remove foot wear. An app is downloaded. With that app - the 3D AI videos can be captured and saved. Very very vast area with huge collections

I visited Art in Paradise last week and it was an unexpectedly delightful experience. This 3D art museum is so much different to usual tourist attractions. This is a place to visit for creativity, illusion, and a bit of fun photography, this is a must-visit if you anyone mentioned above.

The museum is divided into themed zones, from ancient ruins and underwater worlds to fantasy landscapes and optical illusions. Each section is filled with meticulously painted artworks that come alive through clever 3D / AR . The key here is interaction: visitors are encouraged to pose, act, and become part of the art, which makes it especially engaging for families, couples, and even solo travelers.

Staff members are friendly and available to help with photo angles at the entrance. There are guides on the floor showing where to stand for the perfect shot, which is a helpful touch.

I appreciated how well-maintained the facility was. Cleanliness and lighting were top-notch, and crowd control was decent, even on a weekend afternoon. You'll easily spend  2 hours here, especially if you're aiming to capture fun memories.

Overall, Art in Paradise is more than a museum. Whether you're looking for a playful outing or Instagram-worthy photos, this spot delivers a unique blend of art and entertainment. Definitely worth the entrance fee.

The AR moving pictures can be seen only through the app. The staff is very nice and helps to download it and explains how to use it.

We thought it would be a quick art gallery visit, but there are a lot of paintings and halls, so it is better to allocate sufficient time for the visit.

We first saw through the app what happens on the pictures and then created our own scenes with the paintings. It was fun, and we made a lot of great videos.

The videos made through the app look cool. For the photos, I used standard camera, as photoes through the app were a bit blurred (though regular camera doesn't have 3d AR effects).

If you make photos with lion cubs, make sure to ask staff to use a standard camera on your phone and not the app. Otherwise, the photos will be blurred.

The kids were happy and we all had a lot of fun.

reviews.text: This beach is a nice spot to relax and enjoy a quiet moment by the water. The sand is clean, the sea is calm, and it's perfect for a walk or simply sitting down to admire the view. The sunsets are particularly lovely, with a soft light that's perfect for ending the day üòé‚òÄÔ∏èüôÇüôèüåá

Visited on the weekend and it wasn't crowded at all-not surprising though, as the water isn't very clean. It's okay for a stroll or to relax by the shore, but not ideal for swimming. Also, be careful if you're a tourist-many shopkeepers charge quite high prices, so it's best to compare or ask locals first. Still, it's a more peaceful alternative to Pattaya Beach.

Jomtien Beach is a nice, long beach with a huge promenade that's perfect for a walk. It has a relaxed atmosphere with plenty of sun umbrella areas and food stalls, making it a great place to spend the day. I found it to be especially enjoyable during the day.
‚ÄãJust be aware that some sections are currently under construction, so you might need to watch out for that. Also, people tend to do a lot of activities early in the morning, which adds a lively touch to the atmosphere.

reviews.text: I Recommend This place is perfect if you're into fun and entertainment. Lots of lights, music, and big crowds it's always lively with plenty of things to do. There are quite a lot of foreign tourists too since it's one of Thailand's must-visit landmarks.

The beach was okay for a casual visit. It was a bit crowded, but there were places to sit and relax. The water was decent, though not very clear. A few food stalls and shops nearby made it convenient. Nothing too special, but fine for spending a few hours.

A lovely spot with sandy shores and inviting waters, Pattaya Beach shines in June when it's pleasantly uncrowded and peaceful. it could be a bit cleaner during this off-peak time, and the vibrant city lights at night create a beautiful, relaxing view along the coast. Ideal for unwinding evening strolls by the sea with a soothing breeze and calm ambiance.

places.name: Thepprasit Night Market

reviews.text:
Review just for this Food stall(see pictures)
In my never-ending quest for the best Massaman curry, I stumbled upon this stall (see photos) inside Thepprasit Night Market. The large pieces of chicken are cooked to perfection in a rich, flavorful gravy. The taste is incredible-well-balanced and not overly sweet like many others. It's on the spicier side for a Massaman, which is a big plus for me.

I thought I had already found the best Massaman in Pattaya, but I might have to reconsider. Plus, they offer so many other curries and dishes-I can't wait to try more. Absolutely amazing. Highly recommended!

If you're looking for a night market in Thailand that caters more to locals than tourists, Theprasit Night Market is a great find. Many of the food options here were completely new to me, food I haven't come across in the more touristy night markets. It's a refreshing and authentic experience.

The star of the market, for me, was a carinderia-style stall where locals-many of whom looked like they had just come from work-lined up to buy food to take home for dinner. It felt very genuine and gave me a glimpse into everyday Thai life beyond the usual tourist trail.

These markets are huge, there are a large amount of stalls with everything you want but I personally think you need to come here for the food stalls. There is every type of street vendor here and it is amazing. Walk around and buy snippets of food and take it to the tables and enjoy your feast all with flavours to die for and a cost that is ridiculously cheap. Be adventurous and try things you haven't before. Do yourself a favour and do not miss these markets.

Situated on the beachfront of the Hard Rock Hotel Pattaya, it provides a perfect blend of fantastic food, drinks, and entertainment. Surrounded by tropical palm trees and just across from pristine beaches, this iconic venue is within easy reach of top attractions like the Sanctuary of Truth and Nong Nooch Tropical Botanical Garden.

sources.snippet: Photo: Kober / Wikimedia Commons / Image For Representation Only. Nothing beats a wild night at Pattaya‚Äôs Hard Rock Caf√© if rock and roll is what you love. places.name: Hard Rock Cafe Pattaya

reviews.text:
While Hard Rock Cafe may not quite live up to its previous hype, it definitely holds a special, memorable place for us.

We were here to enjoy our usual beloved dishes: the nachos, fajitas, and hot fudge brownies. Although we also adore the potato skins, we didn't order them this time because the food portions here are simply massive, even for individual servings.

For beverages, the Classic Caribbean mojito and margarita are excellent choices, though we noted they don't have a frozen option. The service here is always remarkably friendly and welcoming from the moment you step inside. We continue to have a strong affection for this place.

Had a fantastic time at Hard Rock Cafe Pattaya! The atmosphere is lively and full of energy, making it the perfect spot to hang out and enjoy the night. The live music was excellent, creating a fun vibe that kept the place buzzing.

The food was really good, well-prepared, flavorful, and served in generous portions. I was pleasantly surprised to see they also have gluten-free options, which makes it much easier for those with dietary needs to enjoy the menu.

On top of that, the service was top-notch-friendly, attentive, and always with a smile.

Overall, a great experience and definitely a place I'd recommend for anyone visiting Pattaya who wants good food (with gluten-free choices), great service, and a true Hard Rock vibe.

We had a lovely chance to try the new local burger at Hard Rock Cafe, launched just today as part of their Hard Rock World Burger Tour. I was lucky to be there on the first day and got to try the Satay Burger, absolutely delicious. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•üçî

As always, the ambiance was amazing, vibrant, welcoming, and full of great energy. We truly enjoyed every moment. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•üé∏

A big thank you to the team for the warm hospitality and tasty food. Special shoutout to Manager Joseph and Rainy üíñ for the lovely vibes and excellent service. üôè

Located at the Birds and Bees Resort in Pattaya, this establishment uses its proceeds to make condoms as common as cabbages in Thailand, aiming to prevent STIs and backstreet abortions. The restaurant offers halal Thai food with quirky decor and a beachside view.

reviews.text: This is my second time here. I usually arrive about half an hour before sunset, when the place is still quiet-perfect for taking photos. But as the sun sets, more people start to show up, and the later it gets, the livelier the atmosphere becomes. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, plus you get a beautiful seaside view. The staff are friendly and welcoming, and I'm impressed every time I visit.

I've been to this restaurant many times, and the quality is consistently excellent. The Thai food is delicious, and the seafood is incredibly fresh. I absolutely have to recommend their steamed squid with lime sauce ‚Äì it's the best I've ever had in Thailand: so fresh, clean, and high-quality! All the other dishes are fantastic too. I love this place and highly recommend it to everyone. It's located within a hotel, with beautiful gardens and lots of trees, and you can even walk straight down to the beach from here. It's truly an experience everyone should try!

Food was mostly very tasty and good value. Drinks too. Lovely view. Perfect location.

I would definitely visit again.

But the kitchen does not make your food at the same time as the people at your table. Usually, I would eat my food before or after my family. Sometimes up to 15 mins apart. They should be able to time it better so families can eat together at the same time. But this is a problem all over Thailand, not just here.

And the staff (at breakfast, lunch, and dinner) are strict about where you can sit. We could rarely choose our own table and were often moved around, and they said we could not sit here or there.

And I'd suggest giving traditional paper menus to customers, not electronic tablets. There aren't enough tablets, so you have to wait for another table to finish ordering before you can get the menu. Also, it's difficult to see the menu using a tablet. After a week here, I still missed things that are on the menu because I didn't see them.

reviews.text:
Nice indoor play place with different attractions. Some attractions are little scary for young kids but some are fun for all ages.

Staff are nice and attentive.

Would recommend ticket package purchase, great deals!

Brought my parents here last year, Nov 2024 & bought the tickets in advance via klook. Since I am with Sr. citizens, I bought a package where I could choose 3 places to go. So I picked Ripley's Believe It or Not, Infinity Maze & Louis Tussad's Waxwork. Ripley's was awesome with lots of eye openers, which bewildered all of us.. then we  march over to Infinity Maze, which is really.. REALLY an adventure for the seniors.. unfortunately, they disallowed videos or photos inside the Maze..  so basically how it works is that you have to wear their shoes protector to keep the place clean. Then you enter a walkway and then go into the 1st room. Everything looks identical..  and you can't see the exit door. Hence, with the gloves they provided you, you have to FIND YOUR WAY OUT!! üòÜ Hahaha.. I love this.. my parents went into panic mood, lol!! They walked back to the entrance where we came in, and I asked them to be patient and spend time looking for the way to the next place. It was a fun game that instantly let everyone feel so united to look for the door.. there are multiple rooms that we need to pass through before we could exit, but each room holds a mystery and gives us different experiences. My advice is, please, please don't get panic, enjoy the claustrophobic feeling, and laugh at yourselves when you recall back the experience. My parents were so relieved when we finally walked back to the main entrance area.. I could just laugh non stop.. üôÉ Last was the Waxwork, and only some statues at the exterior look similar to the real person. Other than that, the rest doesn't have significance resemblance, unfortunately.. we just have fun posing inside.

I have walked around the area many times yet never paid to go into the attractions which appeared to cost B800/person for each one you enter

Personally I think that's expensive.

Obviously meant for the the tourists, who are supposedly rich with cash to flash

I can see and photograph all I want to see for free.

I have never seen many people going into the separate attractions or even walking around, but maybe it gets busier at night

I find it relaxing and a way to coold down from walking in the sun

places.generalDescription: Mini Siam is a captivating miniature park that showcases scaled-down replicas of famous landmarks and historical buildings from Thailand's rich history as well as iconic sites from around the world. Visitors can marvel at miniatures of renowned cultural sites such as Wat Arun, Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall, and Wat Phra Kaew, alongside European landmarks like the Tower Bridge and the Eiffel Tower. The park offers a unique opportunity to feel like a giant while exploring these intricate models.

sources.snippet: If you want to experience a glimpse of the world tour within Pattaya, Mini Siam is the place. It is the most interesting place you can explore in Pattaya with your partner. Mini Siam is a fabulous place that features miniature replicas of various tourist attractions from around the World.

sources.snippet: Mini Siam is an entire park full of miniature replicas of landmarks from around the world. From the Eiffel Tower to Angkor Wat to The Statue of Liberty to relics of Egypt. I was really amazed at how real they all looked.

sources.snippet: This Mini Siam is a famous miniature park attraction in Pattaya. Prepare to take lovely pictures here. Mini Siam is a famous miniature park attraction in Pattaya, Chonburi, Thailand.

places.name: Mini Siam

reviews.text:
Visiting Mini Siam was an enchanting experience that transported me around the world in just a few hours. This miniature park showcases over 100 meticulously crafted replicas of iconic landmarks from Thailand and across the globe, all at a 1:25 scale.

The park is divided into two main sections: Mini Siam, featuring Thai heritage sites like Wat Arun and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, and Mini Europe, displaying international marvels such as the Eiffel Tower, Statue of Liberty, and Sydney Opera House. The attention to detail in each model is astounding, making it a photographer's paradise and an educational journey for visitors of all ages.

I recommend visiting during the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the midday heat and to see the models beautifully illuminated. The park is well-maintained, with friendly staff and ample facilities, including rest areas and souvenir shops.
lets-tour-bangkok.com

Whether you're a history enthusiast, architecture lover, or simply looking for a unique attraction in Pattaya, Mini Siam offers a delightful and informative experience that's not to be missed.

I came here as a kid about 20 years ago, and now I'm back again. It feels like time has frozen. Everything looks just like it did back then. It's a nice place where you can enjoy seeing lots of amazing architecture from around the world.
We came around sunset, so it wasn't too hot and it was nice to walk around. If you're free or just want a change of mood, it's worth a visit.
P.S. Don't expect too much, just come and enjoy it for what it is!

A useful tip: buy the train ride ticket along with your entrance ticket. It's cheaper that way, and the mini train ride is a must-do! It's a fun, relaxing ride around the park, and honestly, it feels like stepping back into your childhood.

Mini Siam is a fantastic place to explore miniature versions of world-famous landmarks and wonders - from the Eiffel Tower to the Statue of Liberty, all in one spot! It's a great place for both adults and kids to enjoy.

I recommend visiting in the evening, when the weather is cooler. Avoid the afternoon if possible - it gets really sunny and hot, which can make it hard to enjoy walking around.

Don't miss this charming attraction - especially the train ride!

places.generalDescription: The Beach Club Pattaya, located at Pullman Pattaya Hotel G, Wong Amat Beach, offers an upscale yet comfortable dining experience at The Glass House. Guests can choose between a romantic indoor setting or a seat on the sandy beach while enjoying international cuisine and cool drinks. This tropical paradise features two expansive swimming pools and provides a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The beach bar offers a great crowd and stunning sunset views, with happy hour specials from 3-5pm.

sources.snippet: Enjoy a simple lunch at The Beach Club Pattaya, a quaint seaside caf√© noted for its laid-back atmosphere and wonderful food. As twilight falls, see the majesty of a Pattaya Beach sunset, the ideal backdrop for romance. Finish the day with a romantic meal at The Sky Gallery, where you may eat great food while admiring panoramic views of the ocean.
sources.shortName: A Dreamy Seven-Day Honeymoon Tour in Pattaya

places.name: The Beach Club Pattaya

reviews.text:
I recently stayed at Pattaya Pullman G, and it was an exceptional experience. The hotel offers a perfect blend of modern design and comfort. My room was spacious, clean, and had a stunning view of the ocean. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the amenities provided were top-notch.

The staff were very friendly and attentive, always greeting me with a smile and willing to help with anything I needed. The breakfast and seafood buffet was excellent, with a wide variety of both Thai and international dishes.

One of the highlights was the infinity pool overlooking the sea ‚Äì it was the perfect place to relax and enjoy the view. The location is also great, with easy access to the beach and nearby attractions.

Overall, I highly recommend Pattaya Pullman G for anyone looking for a relaxing and luxurious stay in Pattaya. I would definitely return on my next visit.

We recently had the pleasure of staying at Pullman Pattaya, and I must say, our experience was truly elevated thanks to the outstanding service provided by Peter. From the moment we arrived, Peter from the Beach Club, looked after us with the utmost care, professionalism, and courtesy. His attention to detail and warm demeanor made us feel genuinely welcomed and well taken care of throughout our stay.
One of the most impressive aspects of Peter's service was how thoughtfully he handled our halal food requirements. He ensured that every meal we were served fully respected our dietary needs, without compromising on quality or taste. His dedication to maintaining these standards made our dining experience stress-free and thoroughly enjoyable.
Peter is undoubtedly an invaluable asset to the Pullman Pattaya team. His level of service is what encourages guests to return again and again. It's rare to encounter someone who not only meets expectations but goes above and beyond to exceed them - and Peter does exactly that.
Thank you, Peter, for making our stay so memorable. We truly appreciate your efforts and look forward to returning soon!

Fantastic Experience at The Beach Club Pattaya!

I always look forward to visiting The Beach Club Pattaya whenever I'm in town, and this time was no exception! The highlight was definitely Patty, the amazing waitress. She was attentive, friendly, and made sure all my needs were met with a smile.
The overall staff at the beach club and restaurant are fantastic. They're incredibly accommodating and go out of their way to make guests feel welcome. Whether it's a special request or just a friendly chat, they make the experience memorable.
I've been coming back to The Beach Club every time I visit Pattaya, and I can't recommend it enough. Great food, beautiful views, and a wonderful team‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®

Also I loved the daily buffet breakfast - there was a great variety of delicious food to start the day. The highlight for me was the staff, especially Peter, who was incredibly helpful and kind. He makes a very good cappuccino and was always attentive, kindly asking if anyone needed coffee or anything else. His warm and friendly attitude really made the breakfast experience extra special. Highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Rabbit Resort Pattaya is a charming beachfront retreat located on the northern end of Jomtien Beach, also known as Dongtan Beach. The resort offers 49 rooms and villas designed in a traditional Thai village style, surrounded by lush tropical gardens. Guests can enjoy spacious accommodations with wooden flooring, comfortable beds, clean washrooms, French windows, and private balconies overlooking the mesmerizing views.

sources.shortName: The Ultimate Guide to a Romantic Holiday in Pattaya City

places.name: Rabbit Resort Pattaya

reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay at Rabbit Resort! The place is peaceful, beautifully maintained, and full of charm. I was told I'm the first Jordanian guest to visit the resort in 25 years - truly an honor! Big thanks to the staff for the excellent service and warm hospitality. Special thanks to the lovely owners for their kindness and respectful attitude. You made my experience unforgettable. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Pattaya!

Had a lovely few days at Rabbit Resort. The chalets are really quite charming, very big in size with a decent bathroom and wardrobe. The pool was lovely, they have 2 but we only used one, a walk in pool which is great if you have mobility issues. Breakfast was nice enough, not a buffet as it was low season but a menu to choose one item from and then a small buffet with bread, egg station and fruits. The whole stay was lovely. The owner is on site every day to greet you, which was nice. The only negative was being asked to write a positive review. I would have done so anyway as it's a lovely place so she didn't have to do this! Woudl I stay here again, absolutely.

As regular visitors we love staying here. Rabbit Resort is right in the sea front and welcomes us with our large and friendly dog every time. The rooms are traditionally decorated in a beautiful Thai style. The service is excellent and nothing is too much trouble. Highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: Pattaya Floating Market is a vibrant and popular attraction that offers a unique shopping experience. It combines the charm of traditional Thai floating markets with the convenience of a reconstructed setting, making it safe and easy to navigate. Visitors can explore a wide range of high-quality goods, including clothing, handicrafts, art, and jewelry. The market also features cultural demonstrations and opportunities to dine on delicious Thai cuisine from various regions of the country.

sources.snippet: Pattaya Floating Market: A Journey Through Love on Water: Embrace the charm of Pattaya‚Äôs Floating Market, where couples can embark on a romantic boat ride through meandering waterways. Immerse yourselves in the vibrant atmosphere as you explore floating stalls offering local delicacies, handmade crafts, and traditional souvenirs. Pattaya honeymoon packages often feature this market as a unique and memorable experience for couples.
sources.shortName: 7 Romantic Places to Visit in Pattaya | by Travelwithgarima

sources.snippet: Pattaya floating market is one of the unique buzzing places to visit in Pattaya for couples. Sectioned into 4 different regions that specifically sell items from the four major parts of Thailand (south, northeast, central, and northeast). You can visit and explore the market featuring 114 shops which boast fresh fruit stalls, eateries selling local delicacies, souvenir shops and so much more.
sources.shortName: 20 Romantic Places to Visit & Things to Do in Pattaya 2025

sources.snippet: The Floating market is one of the most recommended places to visit during your Pattaya holiday. The delightful experience of sailing to one of the floating markets in Pattaya in a charming boat will give you an unforgettable experience. You can also shop local fruits, souvenirs, and feast upon authentic Thai cuisine in one of the floating restaurants in the market.
sources.shortName: What to expect in Pattaya with your wife?

sources.snippet: A bustling market located right on the water, opens another avenue to it, where you get a glimpse of the real Thai culture and its food. This is the best Romantic place to visit in Pattaya at night. The whole market is spread over a vast space with traditional Thai-styled wooden houses and stilt shops connected from each other through wooden walkways and waterways.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Pattaya for Couples

sources.snippet: Pattaya‚Äôs own little Venice, the 10-hectare floating market comprises of over 100 vendors and stalls. Traditional and local Thai produce and souvenirs are sold here and unique delicacies are waiting to be discovered if you‚Äôre brave enough to try things like crocodile meat or roasted insect. What makes this site so unique is its division into four segments.
sources.shortName: 23 UNIQUE Things to Do in Pattaya [in 2024]

sources.snippet: Exploring the Pattaya Floating Market is one of the unique couple's activities in Pattaya. The market is divided into 4 different areas, corresponding to typical products of 4 regions of Thailand: Southern, Northeastern, Central, and Northwestern.
sources.shortName: Top 12 Best Activities for Couples in Pattaya

sources.snippet: One of the Pattaya attractions we are proud to present is the Pattaya floating market. Embark on a culturally rich boat ride at Pattaya floating market. It is one of the most localize tourist attractions in Pattaya that you just cannot skip.
sources.shortName: Where to visit in Pattaya | Pattaya Attractions for Family

sources.snippet: A visit to the Pattaya floating market is a must-do for couples. The market is located on the outskirts of Pattaya and offers a wide variety or local produce, as well some delicious street food!
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things to Do in Pattaya for Couples

sources.snippet: Take a romantic boat ride, sample delicious local food, find unique souvenirs, and witness traditional Thai performances. A truly magical experience awaits.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Pattaya: Perfect Destinations for Couples

places.name: Pattaya Floating Market

reviews.text:
Had a good time at Pattaya Floating Market. Nice place to walk around and see local culture. You can buy souvenirs, try different Thai foods, and pick up some gifts for family and friends.

The boat rides inside the market are fun, and you get to see shops selling things from the boats too. Some cultural shows also happen there, which was interesting to watch.

Overall, a good experience. Worth visiting if you're in Pattaya.

Pattaya Floating Market is a charming and vibrant place that offers a unique cultural experience. It's beautifully designed to reflect traditional Thai architecture, and walking through the wooden bridges and canals really gives you the feeling of being in old-world Thailand. There are plenty of shops and stalls selling local handicrafts, souvenirs, clothes, and delicious Thai street food.

The boat ride was a lovely touch ‚Äì cruising through the canals while seeing the market from the water added an extra layer of charm. There are also live performances and cultural shows throughout the day, which are fun and colorful.

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that some parts felt a bit commercialized, with prices higher than usual local markets. It's also quite busy during peak hours, so coming early is a good idea to avoid crowds and heat.

That said, it's still a great place to spend a few hours exploring, taking photos, and enjoying authentic Thai snacks. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Pattaya and want to experience something traditional and family-friendly. A fun and scenic destination for tourists of all ages!

We visited this place as a part of our city tour package. The place is not very clean. They offered lunch in the package as well but we did not take the lunch there as the place did not look very clean. But the place is a great place to get the cultural exposure to the Thai culture and you can do some shopping here as well

places.name: Glass House Boho

reviews.text:
Chill vibes by the sea
Loved the laid-back atmosphere with a cool, stylish decor. The Thai food was bold, spicy, and full of flavor. Great spot to hang out, enjoy the breeze, and   Watch the sunset.

After a long drive touring around Pattaya from Bangkok, Glass House Hobo on Cave Beach is a beautiful place to unwind. The beachfront setting is fantastic - relaxing vibes, great photo spots, and a scenic view that makes it worth a stop, especially if you're looking to chill by the sea with some food and drinks.

However, when it comes to value, the prices are noticeably higher than what you'd pay at other local restaurants in Pattaya or even Bangkok. While the food and atmosphere are good, it might not feel quite worth it if you're on a budget. Great for the experience and ambiance, but not the best pick if you're looking for more affordable local eats.

Beautiful Spot, but pricey for what you get.

Ok, I was thinking about being generous and giving 3 stars but just couldn't do it.  Of course the staff is awesome as in most places in Thailand but that can not make up for the world's worst seating known to humans.  Who wants to sit on the sandy ground in a dirty bean bag(chair, not chair) with a table to bang your knees on. Combine this with cranking disco dance rap music too loud to really talk at the beach Glass house seating (The Cave has a DJ). We opted for the adult chairs on the beach to watch the sunset and it was ok save the high volume music. There are some adult chairs inside near the road side.  Food was mehhh.. as expected.  You don't come here for the food.  If you come,  have a beer on the beach and watch the sunset and that's it! Be careful getting to the bathroom as it's 3 flights up. The Cave next door is the same owner and similar seating only worse. It's the same menu as well. Both places are run down and need renovation. You can Try the salted cashews. Pretty good. Pictures were taken on Saturday night at 7pm.

places.generalDescription: Bang Saray Beach, located in Pattaya, is a hidden gem with pristine white sand and a tranquil atmosphere. It's an ideal destination for those seeking solitude and relaxation as it's less crowded compared to other beaches in the area. While not as developed, the picturesque views make it perfect for unwinding and capturing stunning moments. The beach offers palm-shaded areas where visitors can bask in the soothing sound of waves and enjoy the warmth of the sun.

sources.snippet: Located approximately a half-hour drive to the north of Pattaya, Bangsaray Beach is one of the best places to enjoy a beautiful beach and a stunning sunset in the evening. The variety of seafood restaurants at Bang Saray on the beach and wooden stilts are places to enjoy the view with your loved ones and great food. When the sun levels out with the ocean, it leaves the viewers with an awe-inspiring view of the colourful sky.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Places to Watch the Sunset in Pattaya

places.name: Bang Saray Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful beach at sunset. Super long beach and plenty of space. Some street food sellers. Some parking on the road that runs along the beach. Popular with families and couples that come to chill on the beach in the evenings.
Quite a long but narrow beach, for swimming the east end of the beach is better and very quiet. Many nice seafood restaurants along the front.

Lovely beach, clean and not crowded at all. Maybe we were lucky because it's not peak tourist season. There is also a safe swim area. The street along the beach has quite a lot of restaurants and bars where you can enjoy both Thai and Western cuisine.

places.generalDescription: Surf & Turf Beach Club & Restaurant is a chic, beachfront dining spot offering international cuisine and cocktails. It provides a unique beachfront experience with a tropical decor of white rattan and light wood, creating a welcoming ambiance. The restaurant specializes in combining meat and seafood, as reflected in its name. Situated right on the beach, it offers surreal painted seascapes and plenty of indoor and outdoor seating options.

sources.snippet: Are you looking for one of the most romantic places in Pattaya Thailand with calm surroundings?. Allow us to show you the way!. Surf and Turf Beach Restaurant is a marvelous restaurant that offers many options that will suit your taste.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Things to Do in Pattaya for Couples

places.name: Surf & Turf Beach Club & Restaurant

reviews.text:
We had dinner here and ordered the rib-eye steak, crab rice and chicken wings. The steak was cooked to perfection, juicy and it melts in your mouth. I'd say for 800 Baht, given the quality of the meat, it's a steal. The chicken wings and crab rice are great too.

The staff are very attentive and even with the language barrier, they try their best to accommodate all are requests. We sat by the beach front, under the tree but there are few flies flying by our table so we requested if we could transfer to a different table. The staff offered that we transfer to the airconditioned dining area since the flies will still be there if we will transfer to another table outside, explaining that it's normal when sat outside. But we wanted to be at the beach front so we opted to stay outside.

The ambience in the restaurant is very relaxing and it's not too crowded and noisy compared the the restaurants by the beach road.

Food was overall ok. Deep fried corn&shrimp and fish&chips were good but the burger was a bit below my expectations. The mango pancake for dessert was very delicious.

The unique selling point about this place is the location with amazing sunset view. On top, there was some live music from 6 pm.

From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel like VIPs. They were warm, welcoming, and incredibly attentive without being intrusive. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu, offering great recommendations and making sure we had everything we needed. The entire team worked seamlessly to create a relaxed and enjoyable dining experience.

Of course, the seafood was fresh and perfectly prepared, but what truly set this restaurant apart was the exceptional service. It's rare to find a place where the staff genuinely cares about making your meal special. We'll definitely be back!

places.generalDescription: Experience the awe-inspiring Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm, located just a short distance from Na Klua Beach. This 70-acre site boasts an extensive collection of ancient stones and petrified trees, creating a picturesque setting for visitors to explore and take photos. The park also features live shows with ferocious crocodiles, including talent displays and adrenaline-pumping performances.

sources.snippet: Witness for the first time magnificent age-old stones combined with shows of ferocious crocodiles at The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm. Filled with monstrous rocks and unique plants, this Pattaya park will make you feel earthly and calm. Also, you will see white tigers, giraffes, cassowaries, ostriches, giant catfish, elephants, bears, Thepha fish, etc.
sources.shortName: Where to visit in Pattaya | Pattaya Attractions for Family

places.name: The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm

reviews.text:
Oh, my first time to visit and I love it. I was glad we were able to come and see the park. Upon entering you will be greeted by preserved stones, woods, even stalagmites preserved through millions of years, and the setting is just awesome and mesmerizing. I just hope they would have places labels for more information. Then, the next host - a float of crocodiles. Huge, scary, and powerful creatures ( a total hair raiser), then there are giraffes, elephants, crocodile show (a mixture of comedy and fear), tigers, and other animals and birds.

A nice place to explore whether you are alone, with a partner, or with a group. Just please be careful of your things and be mindful of the rules and restrictions.

Toilets can be found near the entrance and at the middle of the park.

Ticket for foreigner is 500 baht but if you have your work permit with you (just show your work permit or a photo of your wp), you will only pay 200 baht.

I will definitely come back amd visit this place again, I just hope I won't dream of crocodiles tonight. Haha.

Heartbroken by What I Saw ‚Äì Please Don't Support This Place

I'm not an animal rights activist. I'm just a normal traveler who usually enjoys proper, well-run zoos and wildlife parks.
But visiting Million Years Stone Park in Pattaya broke my heart - and I feel responsible to warn others.
It was a mistake.

At first, the park looks impressive. But the truth behind the shows is heartbreaking:
‚Ä¢	The tigers looked exhausted, breathing heavily, some making sounds that honestly felt like crying. Others didn't even move, which is not how a healthy tiger should behave. Trainers kept forcing them to open their mouths for tourist photos, even though they clearly didn't want to. Their eyes could barely stay open. It's obvious they are heavily sedated - they don't even bother closing the cages because the tigers are too weak to move.
After my visit, I looked at photos online and realized it's always the same two tigers used for all the tourist photos. They are chained so tightly they can't even stand or lie down properly.
‚Ä¢	The crocodile show was disgusting and made me feel genuinely uneasy, with handlers taunting and dragging the crocodiles around for entertainment.
‚Ä¢	The elephants were chained tightly with barely any space to move - even after hours, there was nowhere for them to roam.
‚Ä¢	The giraffes were standing out in the blazing sun with minimal shade for the number of animals, left to suffer in the heat and likely hunger.

The enclosures only look nice on the surface.
When you really look, they are far too small, poorly built, and depressing - some cages are barely bigger than a bathroom.

This isn't conservation.
It's pure exploitation.
There's nothing educational or inspiring here - just sadness dressed up for tourists.

Don't let the cheap ticket fool you.
You're far better off spending the same money at a proper zoo or a true sanctuary where animals are respected and cared for.

In 2025, smart, compassionate travelers are choosing better.
Compassion is the new luxury - and true travel memories should leave you proud, not uneasy.

If you are human with a heart, and you believe slavery is wrong, then you should also believe no animal deserves to live this way.
Please don't support this cruelty.

I deeply regret going there.
No one should be encouraged to happily take photos with an enslaved, suffering animal.

Visited The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm and it was a wonderful experience.

The place is very calm, beautifully scenic, and extremely well maintained. There are many animals around including tigers, crocodiles, giraffes, horses, and a variety of birds.

A great spot to spend time with family and enjoy nature along with wildlife. Highly recommend visiting! Cheers!

places.generalDescription: KAAN SHOW PATTAYA is a family-friendly spectacle that combines live performances, film, acrobatics, and special effects to narrate a timeless tale. The show takes place in a grand theater with a capacity of 1,000 people and features over 100 skilled performers. The performance is tailored to the audience's nationality and includes various cultural elements such as Thai, Korean, Vietnamese, Chinese, Russian, and Indian influences.

sources.snippet: KAAN Show is an exciting and unique attraction that couples can enjoy in Pattaya. The show combines live action, acrobatics, and special effects to tell the story of a young boy who embarks on a magical adventure. With stunning visual displays and captivating performances, KAAN Show offers an immersive experience that will leave couples in awe.
sources.shortName: ‚ÄúRomantic Spots in Pattaya: Top Picks for Couples‚Äù | by Vtsix Condos At View Talay 6 Pattaya

places.name: KAAN SHOW PATTAYA

reviews.text:
World Class show with lots of interesting performance and techniques. You will absolutely enjoy 1.30 hours show. The story is about Thai classic literatures mixing with modern style and fun wonders.

MUST NOT MiSS especially for kids from 5 yrs old and up. After the show you can get closer to the performers by paying 100 the photography ticket per 1 adult (kids under 100 cm is free).

Not bad, but not world class. An alright time pass for one evening. Would have gotten more stars if the lighting and sound would have been better. The screen behind was too dark and the spotlights blending our eyes and the sound and music way too loud.
The story is good and many of the mechanical props just fantastic. The actors were very good and enthusiastic, and there was some fantastic acrobatics specially at the pirateship part. I think this is a good show to take your kids to.

Definitely worth seeing. 60 min show cost about $120AU. Our seats were up the back but the view was still good.
I thought the use IMAX style screen combining stage props worked well. At times created a visual experience. Lighting was fantastic and the sound system was excellent. Your not allowed to take any video footage or use flash photography.
You can take as many pictures as you like.
Overall a very enjoyable night out.

places.generalDescription: Walking Street in Pattaya, Thailand is a vibrant and lively promenade that comes alive at night. Spanning a full kilometer from Beach Road to Bali Hai Plaza, it is lined with an array of entertainment options including go-go bars, nightclubs, beer bars, and restaurants. The surrounding side streets offer even more choices for nightlife enthusiasts. From karaoke bars to sports bars and discotheques, there's something for everyone here.

sources.snippet: Walking Street is a vibrant and bustling area in Pattaya that comes alive at night, making it a popular spot for couples seeking an exciting nightlife experience. This iconic street is lined with numerous bars, clubs, restaurants, and entertainment venues offering a wide range of options for couples to enjoy together. From live music performances to cabaret shows and cultural performances, Walking Street has something for everyone.

You can walk hand in hand with your partner down Walking Street, which will be illuminated by its neon lights.

Once in a lifetime experience. If you are like me who does not drink and do that stuff, visiting walking st is a must experience and only a one time experience but if you love doing ADVENTOURUS thing and its a heaven for youüòÖüòÇ
